Description: Papyrus written with black ink with legal document dated year 17 of Ptolemy III Euergetes I, Epeiph. 5 ll. on recto, names of 16 witnesses on verso. Thompson's MS Catalogue: "Agreement for partition of property between Thot-sotem son of Panofer and his nephew Panofer son of Psennenter, by which the former conveys to the latter certain tomb-liturgies. There is a counterpart of the same date at Berlin (P. dem. 3089) by which Panofer conveys to his uncle Thot-sotem the remaining liturgies. The names of the witnesses (so far as extant) are identical in the two documents. [...] Cf. no. 10377"
Curator's comments: Thompson's MS Catalogue: "Published (extract only) by Revillout, rev. eg.I.p.135 pl.8 Cf. Spiegelberg, Demot. Pap. Berlin p.b. whose reference to it is mistaken."
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1990a / Catalogue of Demotic Papyri in the British Museum IV: Ptolemaic Legal Texts from the Theban Area (p.50-52, pl.37-9)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (2724) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/2724)
